snippet: Heat forward Chris Bosh was in Miami early Thursday for his son Jackson’s birth, and in the starting lineup later in New York against the Knicks.
abstract: Miami Heat forward Chris Bosh returns to New York less than an hour before the start of Game 3 of playoff series against New York Knicks after witnessing his wife give birth to their son in Miami. (M)a
lead_paragraph: Forty minutes before Thursday night's playoff game between the Knicks and the Miami Heat, Chris Bosh's No. 1 Heat jersey hung in an otherwise empty locker inside the visiting locker room at Madison Square Garden. Bosh's absence was understandable. About 16 hours earlier, his wife, Adrienne, had given birth in Miami to the couple's first child, a son, Jackson. But at 6:30 p.m. Thursday, with the opening tip-off of Game 3 in the Knicks-Heat playoff series half an hour away, Bosh walked into the Heat locker room, where he was greeted by cheering teammates.

headline.main: For the Heat's Bosh, It's a Son in the Morning and a Game at Night
